meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Chris Wallace Katty Kay Dr. Mehmet Oz Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6378.

div.div:
2012 Power Players Week game 3.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

td.p: Chris Wallace, a TV host from Fox News Sunday
Katty Kay, a Washington, D.C. anchor from BBC World News America
Dr. Mehmet Oz, a cardiac surgeon and TV host from The Dr. Oz Show

tr.td: FAIR & BALANCED
ABRUPT ABBREVS.
WASHINGTON, D.C.
(Alex: Now you're all here playing for charity, so we're going to test you on your knowledge of...)
STARS & CAUSES
IT'S THE "E"-CONOMY
THE AUDACITY OF HOPE
(Alex: But with a twist. We're talking about Bob Hope.)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'a balanced budget

Katty
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'In March 2012 Rep. Paul Ryan introduced a plan that he said would achieve this fiscal goal in 10 years')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: In March 2012 Rep. Paul Ryan introduced a plan that he said would achieve this fiscal goal in 10 years

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_3_2', 'clue_J_3_2_stuck', '(Chris: I always knew you were gonna ask one of these questions. What is [*]?)
(Alex: Yes. [Chuckles] All right, we have a minute to go now, Chris.)

Canada

Chris
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_3_2', 'clue_J_3_2_stuck', '(Alex presents the clue from the Newseum in Washington, D.C.) From the front balcony of the Newseum, we can easily see its neighbor, the embassy of this longtime U.S. ally; it\'s the embassy that\'s closest to the U.S. Capitol building')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Alex presents the clue from the Newseum in Washington, D.C.) From the front balcony of the Newseum, we can easily see its neighbor, the embassy of this longtime U.S. ally; it's the embassy that's closest to the U.S. Capitol building

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Dr. Oz
Katty
Chris
(lock game)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Dr. Oz: I was going [*]. Couldn\'t do the math quite fast enough.)
(Alex: Well, you went with the right response.)
...
(Alex: Katty Kay, what about you?)
(Katty: [before her response is revealed]: I also went with [*], but, um...)
(Alex: You didn\'t risk much?)
(Katty: I didn\'t risk enough money.)
...
(Katty: I was never gonna catch up with Chris anyway.)
(Alex: Good. You figured that out.)
[Laughter]
...
(Chris: I did have to do the adding, it didn\'t come so quickly, but I did pick [*].)
Dr. OzWhat is Gone With The Wind
$2,900
KattyWhat is gone with the wind
$200
ChrisWhat is "Gone with the Wind"?
$3,400
Gone with the Wind')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'In 2011, in the preface to the 75th anniversary edition, Pat Conroy called this novel "the last great... victory of the Confederacy"')

tr.td: AMERICAN LITERATURE
In 2011, in the preface to the 75th anniversary edition, Pat Conroy called this novel "the last great... victory of the Confederacy"
Dr. Oz
Katty
Chris
3rd place: $10,000 to HealthCorps
2nd place: $10,000 to the International Women's Media Foundation
Winner: $50,000 to Hope for the Warriors
Dr. Oz
Katty
Chris

6 R,
1 W

12 R,
1 W
(including 1 DD)

22 R
(including 1 DD),
1 W

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
